bibl.title: Charles Smith v. John Coldwell. Application for Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: FILE No.5954
In the District Court of the 3rd Judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at Seattle W.T.
In the matter of the application of Charles Smith for a writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Hon. R.A. Jones, Judge of the District court of the 3rd Judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at said City of Seattle
The petition of Charles Smith respectfully shows;

That Charles Smith is unlawfully imprisoned, detained, confined and restrained of his liberty by John Coldwell at his office on Washington Street in said City of Seattle in said King County Wash. Terr.

That the said imprisonment, detention, confinement and restraint are illegal and that the illegality thereof consists in this to wit; That upon the the face of said warrant or process under and by virtue of which said Smith was arrested and is detained it appears that no offense has been committed contrary to the laws of this the Territoryof Washington. That said writ does not state that the defendant has removed or dispased of his property or is about to do so with intent to defraud his

creditors, but simply state that "on the 9th day of May 1888, Charles Smith left his late residence with intent to defraud his creditors" and the said Writ is therefore and for other reasons shown upon the face thereof fatally defective and void, and the said imprisonment, detention, confinement and restraint thereunder is illegal.

Wherefore your petitioner prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted directed to the said John Coldwell commanding him to have the body of said Charles Smith before your honor at a time and place therein to be specified, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered by your honor concerning him, together with the time and cause of said detention and said writ, and that he may be restored to his liberty
Dated on the 10th day of May A.D. 1888
Charles M. Smith Peterson + Haller Attys. for said Chas. Smith
Territory of Washington County of King

Charles M. Smith being first duly sworn on oath says: That he is the petitioner named in the above entitled action; that he has heard the foregoing petition read, knows the contents thereof, and believes the same to be true; that he makes this affidavit because Charles Smith
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 10th day of May 1888
Fred. H. Peterson Notary Public in and for Washington Territory
In the District Court 3rd Judicial District, holding terms at Seattle
In the Chas Smith petition for habeas corpus
FILED MAY 10 1888 W.E. Ledgerwood, Clerk.
Peterson + Fallen for petitioner
